meanings.definition: The act of removing or destroying the cerebrum.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, the doctor performed decerebration to save the patient's life.
meanings.sent2: The decerebration of the brain was necessary to prevent further damage.
meanings.sent3: The decerebration of the cerebrum made the patient forget their favorite childhood memories.
meanings.sent4: The decerebration of the cerebrum was like erasing a chalkboard, wiping away all thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The decerebration of the cerebrum left a blank canvas in the patient's mind.

meanings.sent1: The decerebration of the patient led to a loss of cognitive functions.
meanings.sent2: His decerebration was evident in his inability to speak or move.
meanings.sent3: The decerebration of his brain turned him into a silent observer of the world.
meanings.sent4: In the decerebration state, he felt detached from reality, like a ghost in his own body.
meanings.sent5: The decerebration left him in a state of confusion and disorientation.
